title: 108_hr531
content: EXTENDING AVAILABILITY OF SCHIP ALLOTMENTS FOR FISCAL YEARS 1998 THROUGH 2001. The text chunk discusses the extension and revision of retained and redistributed allotments for fiscal years 1998 through 2000 under the Social Security Act. Amendments are made to extend the retention of a portion of the fiscal year 2000 allotment. The text chunk discusses amendments to extend the availability of unexpended funds for fiscal year 2000 under the Social Security Act until the end of fiscal year 2004. Amendments are also made to redistribute allotments for fiscal years 1998, 1999, and 2000. Amendments are made to extend the availability of unexpended funds for fiscal year 2000 under the Social Security Act until the end of fiscal year 2004. Redistribution of allotments for fiscal years 1998, 1999, and 2000 is also addressed. Amendments extend availability of unexpended funds for fiscal year 2000 under the Social Security Act until the end of fiscal year 2004. Redistribution of allotments for fiscal years 1998, 1999, and 2000 is addressed by adjusting specific clauses and amounts. Amendments extend availability of unexpended funds for fiscal year 2000 under the Social Security Act until the end of fiscal year 2004. Redistribution of allotments for fiscal years 1998, 1999, and 2000 is addressed by adjusting specific clauses and amounts, including State expenditures exceeding allotments for fiscal year 2000. The amendments extend the availability of unexpended funds for fiscal year 2000 under the Social Security Act until the end of fiscal year 2004. Redistribution of allotments for fiscal years 1998, 1999, and 2000 is addressed by adjusting specific clauses and amounts, including State expenditures exceeding allotments for fiscal year 2000. Conforming amendments are made to section 2104(g) for fiscal years 1999 and 2000, with further amendments for fiscal year 2001. The amendment extends the availability of unexpended funds for fiscal year 2000 under the Social Security Act until the end of fiscal year 2004. Redistribution of allotments for fiscal years 1998, 1999, and 2000 is addressed by adjusting specific clauses and amounts, including State expenditures exceeding allotments for fiscal year 2000. Amendments are made to section 2104(g) for fiscal years 1999 and 2000, with further amendments for fiscal year 2001. The amendment extends the availability of unexpended funds for fiscal year 2000 under the Social Security Act until the end of fiscal year 2004. Amendments are made to section 2104(g) for fiscal years 1999, 2000, and 2001, including adjustments to State expenditures exceeding allotments. The amendment extends the availability of unexpended funds for fiscal year 2000 under the Social Security Act until the end of fiscal year 2004. Amendments are made to section 2104(g) for fiscal years 1999, 2000, and 2001, including adjustments to State expenditures exceeding allotments. Subparagraph (D)(i) is modified by multiplying it by the ratio of the amounts specified in subparagraph (D)(ii) and (D)(iii). Subparagraph (A)(ii) is amended by adding "2001" after "2000" and subparagraph (B) is adjusted by adding a new clause despite subsection (e). The amendment extends the availability of unexpended funds for fiscal year 2000 under the Social Security Act until the end of fiscal year 2004. For fiscal year 2001, funds shall remain available for expenditure by the State through the end of fiscal year 2005. Amounts used in computing redistributions for fiscal year 2001 are specified, taking into account the total amount remaining available. The amendment extends the availability of unexpended funds under the Social Security Act for fiscal years 2000 and 2001. It specifies the amounts used in computing redistributions for fiscal year 2001. Amendments are made to section 2104(g) to reflect these changes. The amendment extends the availability of unexpended funds under the Social Security Act for fiscal years 2000 and 2001, with effective dates specified for the changes made. The House of Representatives passed the amendment on June 26, 2003.
